verbose_text: NF-kappaB is activated via phosphorylation and degradation of IkappaB, an inhibitory factor of NF-kappaB, by the IkappaB kinase (IKK) enzyme complex XREF_BIBR, XREF_BIBR, which leads to the nuclear translocation of NF-kappaB and the subsequent transcription of NF-kappaB-dependent genes, such as the IL-6, MCP-1, cyclooxygenase-2 (COX-2) and inducible nitric oxide synthase (iNOS) genes.
evidence: NF-kappaB is activated via phosphorylation and degradation of IkappaB
